snippet: Pacific Bell has been fined $44 million and may have to pay back millions more in customer refunds after a judge for the California Public Utilities Commission ruled this week that the local phone company had engaged in overly aggressive and decep...
lead_paragraph: Pacific Bell has been fined $44 million and may have to pay back millions more in customer refunds after a judge for the California Public Utilities Commission ruled this week that the local phone company had engaged in overly aggressive and deceptive marketing practices. Consumer advocates hailed the ruling, saying it set a new benchmark for honesty in the competitive home telecommunications market.
abstract: California Public Utilities Commission administrative judge Maribeth Bushey fines Pacific Bell $44 million, ruling company's marketing was overly aggressive and deceptive; orders local phone company to offer customers refunds for unwanted services; consumer advocates hail ruling; company to appeal (M)

headline.main: Pacific Bell Fined Over Marketing Tactics
